publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2873 Rosie Kane: School Pupils’ Evidence to the Public Petitions Committee—That the Parliament thanks the pupils from St Ronan’s Primary School, Innerleithen, and Clyde Valley High School, Wishaw, who gave evidence on separate issues to the Public Petitions Committee on Wednesday 25 May 2005 and the pupils from Bowmore Primary School, Islay, who gave a video presentation on their petition to committee members; considers that all the pupils concerned exhibited knowledge, confidence and authority in presenting their particular petitions; notes that the fact that young people feel able to interact with politicians in this way is an indicator of how accessible the Parliament and politics can be, and considers that it is essential that the Parliament works to ensure that openness and accessibility continues and develops to encourage the widest possible interaction between the Parliament and the people.
